summary:
Fashion Merchandising professional, experience both global and regional in scope, in large market-leading global fashion brand. 
MSc International Business graduate, passionate fashion enthusiast, with strong business acumen and a big appetite for continuous self-improvement and learning. 

Professional experience includes: 
Leading Merchandising teams (non-denim apparel men’s & women’s) | Product Development | Supply Chain Management fashion footwear in India, UK & China.

Proven skills and personality traits include: 
Strong work ethic | High level of adaptability | Fast learner | Self-motivated for continuous company and self-improvement | Cross-cultural communication | Management and training | Capable of handling projects tasks under pressure | Able to work in a high pressure, intensive environment | Competent data manipulation and analytical skills.

education.grade: First Class Honours scored with Distinction

profile_positions.description: Setting the seasonal & annual product strategy | Setting the 5 year brand strategy & financial forecasting | Leading the international alignment process to achieve high levels of product leverage between regions | Managing the regional Marketing product strategy and advertising campaign | Product lead (alongside Creative Director) on seasonal Sustainability & Innovation projects | Team management & development
profile_positions.title: Merchandising Director Calvin Klein Jeans

profile_positions.description: Consolidating global seasonal & annual product strategy | Managing global alignment process of concept & product big ideas | Presenting to Regional Merchandising teams | Team management & development
profile_positions.title: Global Merchandise Manager Women's Calvin Klein Jeans

profile_positions.description:
Top-down & bottom-up range planning | Design briefing | Colour & concept review | Sketch & prototype review | Pricing | Forecasting | Seasonal line presentation & training to Retail & Wholesale Sales Managers | Post-sales evaluation analysis | Best seller analysis | Competitive landscape analysis 

Merchandising perfectly combines my passion for fashion, business acumen and Product Development experience. I am enjoying exercising the hugely varied skill-set required for this multi-faceted role, and the many cross-department relationships that I am building. 

I strongly believe in the balance of qualitative and quantitative aspects of Merchandising, and the importance of product as well as data. I see my role as contributing to upholding brand identity and to evolving brand strategy, just as much as to commercial development. 

I’ve been lucky to be part of the start-up phase of Calvin Klein Europe BV from its early stages, which has given me the opportunity to enjoy great ownership, responsibility, process creation, process change, and a very steep learning curve.
profile_positions.title: Merchandiser Non-Denim Apparel EMEA & APAC Calvin Klein Jeans

profile_positions.description:
Vendor communication | FOB & margin control | Coordinating the development calendar | Style management systems maintenance | Fitting comments | Sample management 

My experience in Product Development was instrumental in equipping me with crucial fabric knowledge, apparel vendor base knowledge, fitting and basic tech knowledge, and other aspects of apparel development. 

This knowledge has proved extremely influential on my career development as a Merchandiser.
profile_positions.title: Product Development Calvin Klein Jeans

profile_positions.description:
- Management of two seasons’ purchases from initial coordination with the Planning department and Buyers, through to the final coordination stage with the Merchandising department, and then the subsequent follow-up on stock performance and repeat order initiation. 

- A high degree of exposure to suppliers and manufacturers in the footwear industry across India, China and Europe, in order to negotiate cost, delivery dates and ensure the company’s needs were being met at the right time, with the right product and at the right price. 

- Plentiful of experience in international communications through coordinating with international suppliers as well as internally with Planning, Senior Buyers, Accounts, Merchandising, Warehouse, Logistics and Senior Management in India and UK.

- Beyond Supply Chain Management, this role also included Buying Support process improvement and new process development, as well as training of teams in India and China. 

Main objectives throughout these roles and responsibilities for this one year project were to improve the process efficiencies of the firm’s supply chain as well as to increase inter-departmental and inter-subsidiary communication and alignment to strategy.

Pavers England is the Indian joint venture subsidiary of Pavers Shoes Ltd, a family owned multi-channel footwear retailer with 100 outlets across the UK and Eire and a history of over 40 years of success. The company has been credited as one of the fastest growing private companies in Europe, as well as winning the UK Trade & Investment Award (2009) 'UK Entry into India' for the Pavers Foresight Smart Ventures JV.

Pavers England is enjoying an extremely exciting rate of growth over its 4 years of experience in India with over 100 retail locations, and will shortly be the first single brand retailer to be granted full FDI status.
profile_positions.title: Buying Support Manager

profile_positions.description:
Four month intensive training course in Planning, Buying and Merchandising at the UK headquarters in York, followed by the above transfer to Pavers' Indian joint venture subsidiary company, Pavers England for a further 9 months. 

Pavers Shoes Ltd is a family owned multi-channel footwear retailer with 100 outlets across the UK and Eire and a history of over 40 years of success.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Management Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Work experience placement which included research and project administration responsibilities as well as international client communication and general organisation duties as PA to the President and Vice President. 

The position also included a paid business trip to an international client in India in June 2010. 

Hemming+Gilman specialises in producing and marketing major corporate events, institutional advancement programs and major non-profit and philanthropic fundraising campaigns. The firm has over thirty years experience in premier fundraising, serving both corporations and non-profit organisations.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Event Coordinator & Assistant to the Executive
